remarks: A graph of order 0 (i.e. with 0 vertices) has a finite set of edges, analogous to ~ usgrafisbase .  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 5-Jan-2018.)  (Revised by AV, 15-Jan-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
usgo0fisALT.o $e |- O = ( # ` ( 1st ` G ) ) $.
usgo0fisALT $p |- ( ( G e. USGrph /\ O = 0 ) -> ( Edges ` G ) e. Fin ) $.
